definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: pass on or away, pass through (mostly poet.) (NH id., pass by or away, change; Ph. [[חלפת]] equivalent, Reinach:RÉJ 1888, 276; Hoffm:G. G. Abh. xxxvi. 1890, 20; Aram. [[חֲלֵף]] pass away, change; h.lap change, substitute; Nab. [[חלף]] change (?) Eut:p. 53; Ar. xalafa come after, succeed, replace [cf. ‘Caliph’ i.e. successor (of Mohammed)] and many deriv. Lane:792–799; so also [[ויחלפה]] MI:6 and his son succeeded him; Eth. xalfa: pass by, across, through)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[חָלַף]] Ct So 2:11 Hb Hab 1:11 etc.; Impf. [[יַחֲלֽף]] Job 4:15 + 4 t.; 3 fs. sf. [[תַּחְלְפֵָהוּ]] Job 20:24; [[יַחֲלָֽפוּ]] Ps 102:27; Inf. cstr. [[לַחֲלוֹף]] Is 21:1; —

definitions.title: 1. a.
definitions.body: pass on quickly 1Sa 10:3; elsewh. only poet., move or sweep on, of a flood Is 8:8, or wind Is 21:1, Job 4:15, Hb Hab 1:11, of God Job 9:11, Job 11:10.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: pass away (vanish) Job 9:26 (of days); Ct So 2:11 (of rain ‖[[עבר]]), of the heavens Ps 102:27, of idols Is 2:l8, (but perhaps gloss JBL:ix. 1890, 86).
of grass, come on anew, i. e. sprout again (cf.

definitions.title: Hiph. 2
definitions.body: ) Ps 90:5, Ps 90:6, so Thes AV De Hi Che Bae al.; less suitably in context, LXX Vulgate Ew pass away, supr.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: pass through, i.e. pierce, sq. acc. Ju Jdg 5:26, Job 20:24.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: overstep, transgress Is 24:5 (‖[[עבר]]), (cf. Ar. IV. to break a promise).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. [[וַיְחַלֵּף]] (cause to pass) change, sq. acc. garment Ge 41:14 (E) 2Sa 12:20.

change (trans.) garments Ge 35:2 (E) Ps 102:27, wages Ge 31:7, Ge 31:41 (both E) ; no obj. expr. Le 27:10 (H); substitute i. e. cause to succeed Is 9:9; change for better, renew, obj. [[כּׂחַ]] Is 40:31, Is 41:1.
shew newness, of tree, putting forth fresh shoots Job 14:7, of bow Job 29:20.
